div.p: Mrs. Elfstrum and Mrs. Evans went to the CoinStar kiosk at Walmart yesterday to deposit our Pennies for Patients money. Our elementary students collected $600.00 for the Leukemia & Lymphoma society before the closure. Way to go!
Today is Cardinal Pride Friday! Let's see your Cardinal Spirit in the comments below... #togethercardsfly
Story Time with Principal Johnson as she reads "Up North at the Cabin" by Marsha Wilson Chall with paintings by Steve Johnson. https://youtu.be/uXRzasLjR5A

Tonight, Tyler Gosch will be recognized at Sourcewell's Students of Character Celebration. Tyler Gosch always treats others with respect. He is kind, funny, and has the biggest smile even when things are always going well. He always greets everyone in the morning and is known for saying, "Have a good day!" at the end of every day. Tyler plans to apprentice with a butcher after school. He has done well in our culinary class and really has a passion for fabricating meat. Click through for more information https://bit.ly/2xtAu0V

Tonight, Morgan Swecker will be recognized at Sourcewell's Student of Character Celebration. Morgan Swecker has been a quiet, steadfast, helpful force to staff, parents and young people in our school and community. Watching her with children, it is easy to see that she has a heart for nurturing young ones. She has volunteered a lot of time in the music department at school as their Teaching Assistant. Morgan plans to pursue an Early Childhood Education degree at Central Lakes College. Click through for more information on the celebration https://bit.ly/2xtAu0V
